result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel A. Fischer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample.  The costs are added to defendant's current payment plan.

The jail sentence shall be served with huber and good time.  The jail sentence shall begin immediately.    The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Consecutive to: Taylor County Case No. 15CF64 and 15CF29

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel A. Fischer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joel A. Fischer in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Defendant Joel A. Fischer in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Written waiver of preliminary hearing filed.  Court questions defendant. Court finds probable cause that a crime was committed and binds defendant over for trial.  Information to be filed.  Attorney Nocco had no objection to Information being filed later.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to count 1 - Possession of Meth.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court dismisses and read in counts 2 and 3.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1.  Court orders six months county jail with huber and good time; consecutive to any other sentence; court costs; DNA sample and surcharge.  - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Joel A. Fischer in court, in custody with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Waive reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Waive time limits for a preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 01:00 pm.  - rt

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Initial Appearance on March 15, 2016 at 1:00 a.m.

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Joel Fischer appeared in court, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $1,000.00 cash bond; booking; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No statement by defendant.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Defendant advised of right to an attorney.  Attorney Tlusty requests that the clerk begin bond revocation proceedings in Case No. 15CF64.  So ordered by the court.  Next court date is March 15,, 2016 at 1:00 pm.  - rt
